title: NIPS_2001_11_abs

sentences.text: A mixed-signal paradigm is presented for high-resolution parallel inner-product computation in very high dimensions , suitable for efficient implementation of kernels in image processing .
At the core of the externally digital architecture is a high-density , low-power analog array performing binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication .
Full digital resolution is maintained even with low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion , owing to random statistics in the analog summation of binary products .
A random modulation scheme produces near-Bernoulli statistics even for highly correlated inputs .
The approach is validated with real image data , and with experimental results from a CID/DRAM analog array prototype in 0.5 cents m CMOS .

Entity-mixed-signal_paradigm.label: mixed-signal paradigm
Entity-mixed-signal_paradigm.description: The mixed-signal paradigm refers to a computational approach that integrates both analog and digital signal processing techniques to achieve high-resolution parallel inner-product computations, particularly for efficient kernel implementations in image processing applications.

Entity-high-resolution_parallel_inner-pr.label: high-resolution parallel inner-product computation
Entity-high-resolution_parallel_inner-pr.description: High-resolution parallel inner-product computation refers to a computational method that utilizes a mixed-signal architecture to efficiently perform inner-product calculations in high dimensions, particularly for applications in image processing, while maintaining digital resolution through low-power analog techniques.

Entity-approach.label: approach
Entity-approach.description: The approach refers to a mixed-signal paradigm for high-resolution parallel inner-product computation that utilizes a low-power analog array for efficient image processing and is validated through experimental results.

Entity-binary-binary_partial_matrix-vect.label: binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication
Entity-binary-binary_partial_matrix-vect.description: Binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication refers to a computational technique used in a mixed-signal architecture that efficiently computes inner products by leveraging a low-power analog array to process binary data, maintaining high digital resolution despite low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion.

Entity-ciddram_analog_array_prototype.label: CID/DRAM analog array prototype
Entity-ciddram_analog_array_prototype.description: The CID/DRAM analog array prototype is a hardware implementation designed for high-density, low-power analog processing, specifically for performing binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication in a mixed-signal architecture, validated through experimental results in CMOS technology.

Entity-externally_digital_architecture.label: externally digital architecture
Entity-externally_digital_architecture.description: The externally digital architecture refers to a high-density, low-power analog array designed for performing binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication, which maintains full digital resolution through low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion in high-dimensional inner-product computations.

Entity-random_modulation_scheme.label: random modulation scheme
Entity-random_modulation_scheme.description: A random modulation scheme is a signal processing technique that generates near-Bernoulli statistics from highly correlated inputs, enhancing the performance of analog-to-digital conversion in mixed-signal architectures.

Entity-low-power_analog_array.label: low-power analog array
Entity-low-power_analog_array.description: The low-power analog array is a high-density hardware component designed for efficient binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication within a mixed-signal architecture, enabling high-resolution computations in image processing applications.

Entity-input.label: inputs
Entity-input.description: The term 'inputs' refers to the highly correlated data or variables that are processed by the mixed-signal architecture to produce near-Bernoulli statistics in the context of high-resolution parallel inner-product computation.

Entity-analog_summation_of_binary_produc.label: analog summation of binary products
Entity-analog_summation_of_binary_produc.description: The analog summation of binary products refers to a signal processing technique that combines multiple binary inputs in an analog manner to maintain full digital resolution during low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion, leveraging random statistics to achieve accurate results.

Entity-random_statistic.label: random statistics
Entity-random_statistic.description: Random statistics refers to the statistical properties arising from the analog summation of binary products in a mixed-signal architecture, which allows for the maintenance of full digital resolution despite low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion.

Entity-ciddram.label: CID/DRAM
Entity-ciddram.description: CID/DRAM refers to a prototype of an analog array designed for high-density, low-power computation, specifically used for binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication in image processing applications.

Entity-analog_summation.label: analog summation
Entity-analog_summation.description: Analog summation refers to the process of combining binary products in an analog format, which utilizes random statistics to maintain full digital resolution despite low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion.

Entity-low-resolution_analog-to-digital_.label: low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion
Entity-low-resolution_analog-to-digital_.description: Low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion refers to a process in which analog signals are converted to digital form with reduced precision, yet still allowing for the maintenance of full digital resolution through the use of random statistical techniques in the summation of binary products.

Entity-full_digital_resolution.label: Full digital resolution
Entity-full_digital_resolution.description: Full digital resolution refers to the capability of maintaining high-quality digital output in computations, even when using low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion, achieved through the use of random statistics in the summation of binary products.

Entity-0.5_cent_m_cmos.label: 0.5 cents m CMOS
Entity-0.5_cent_m_cmos.description: 0.5 cents m CMOS refers to a cost-effective fabrication process for a mixed-signal CID/DRAM analog array prototype that enables high-resolution parallel inner-product computation.

Entity-very_high_dimension.label: very high dimensions
Entity-very_high_dimension.description: The term 'very high dimensions' refers to the mathematical concept of spaces with a large number of dimensions, which is relevant in the context of high-resolution parallel inner-product computation for efficient kernel implementation in image processing.

Entity-kernel.label: kernels
Entity-kernel.description: In the context of image processing, 'kernels' refer to mathematical functions used for operations such as convolution, which facilitate high-resolution parallel inner-product computations in very high dimensions.

Entity-near-bernoulli_statistic.label: near-Bernoulli statistics
Entity-near-bernoulli_statistic.description: Near-Bernoulli statistics refer to a statistical behavior generated by a random modulation scheme that approximates the properties of Bernoulli distributions, even when the inputs are highly correlated.

Entity-binary_product.label: binary products
Entity-binary_product.description: Binary products refer to the result of multiplying two binary numbers or values, often used in data representation and mathematical computations.

Entity-analog-to-digital_conversion.label: analog-to-digital conversion
Entity-analog-to-digital_conversion.description: Analog-to-digital conversion is the process of transforming an analog signal into a digital signal by sampling the analog input and quantifying its amplitude into discrete values.

Entity-real_image_data.label: real image data
Entity-real_image_data.description: Real image data refers to actual visual data obtained from real-world images, used in the paper to validate the proposed mixed-signal paradigm for high-resolution image processing.

Entity-cmos.label: CMOS
Entity-cmos.description: CMOS, or Complementary Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor, is a technology used in the fabrication of integrated circuits, particularly for digital logic and analog applications, characterized by low power consumption and high noise immunity.

Entity-digital_resolution.label: digital resolution
Entity-digital_resolution.description: Digital resolution refers to the measure of detail an image holds, typically quantified in pixels, which determines the clarity and quality of digital images.

Entity-modulation_scheme.label: modulation scheme
Entity-modulation_scheme.description: A modulation scheme is a method used in signal processing and communication to encode information onto a carrier signal by varying its properties such as amplitude, frequency, or phase.

Entity-image_processing.label: image processing
Entity-image_processing.description: Image processing is a field of study that focuses on the manipulation and analysis of digital images using algorithms and techniques to enhance, transform, or extract information from visual data.

Entity-highly_correlated_input.label: highly correlated inputs
Entity-highly_correlated_input.description: highly correlated inputs refer to a set of variables or data points that exhibit a strong statistical relationship with each other, indicating that changes in one input are associated with changes in another.

Entity-image_data.label: image data
Entity-image_data.description: Image data refers to digital representations of visual information, typically in the form of pixels, that can be processed, analyzed, and stored by computer systems.

Entity-experimental_result.label: experimental results
Entity-experimental_result.description: Experimental results refer to the data and findings obtained from conducting experiments, typically used to validate hypotheses or assess the performance of a system or method.

summary: A mixed-signal paradigm is presented for high-resolution parallel inner-product computation in very high dimensions , suitable for efficient implementation of kernels in image processing . At the core of the externally digital architecture is a high-density , low-power analog array performing binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication . Full digital resolution is maintained even with low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion , owing to random statistics in the analog summation of binary products . A random modulation scheme produces near-Bernoulli statistics even for highly correlated inputs . The approach is validated with real image data , and with experimental results from a CID/DRAM analog array prototype in 0.5 cents m CMOS .

Predicate-is_presented_for.label: is presented for
Predicate-is_presented_for.description: The predicate 'is presented for' indicates that the subject serves as a means, method, or framework that is being introduced or showcased in relation to the object. It implies that the subject is relevant or applicable to the object, often highlighting its utility, purpose, or significance in a specific context.

Predicate-are_used_in.label: are used in
Predicate-are_used_in.description: The predicate 'are used in' indicates a functional relationship where the subject is employed or applied within the context or domain specified by the object. It suggests that the subject serves a purpose or plays a role in the activities, processes, or practices associated with the object.

Predicate-is_at_the_core_of.label: is at the core of
Predicate-is_at_the_core_of.description: The predicate 'is at the core of' indicates that the subject is fundamental or essential to the object, suggesting that the object is significantly influenced, supported, or defined by the subject. It implies a central relationship where the subject plays a crucial role in the existence, functionality, or conceptual framework of the object.

Predicate-performing.label: performing
Predicate-performing.description: The predicate 'performing' indicates an action or process in which the subject engages in executing or carrying out a specific task or function represented by the object. It establishes a dynamic relationship where the subject is actively involved in the operation or implementation of the object, which typically describes a computational, physical, or procedural activity.

Predicate-is_maintained_with.label: is maintained with
Predicate-is_maintained_with.description: The predicate 'is maintained with' indicates a relationship where the subject is sustained or preserved through the use of the object. It suggests that the object plays a crucial role in ensuring the continuity or stability of the subject, often implying a dependency or support mechanism that allows the subject to remain in a desired state.

Predicate-owes_to.label: owes to
Predicate-owes_to.description: The predicate 'owes to' establishes a causal or attributive relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a result of, or is dependent on, the object. It suggests that the characteristics, qualities, or existence of the subject can be traced back to the influence or contribution of the object.

Predicate-involves.label: involves
Predicate-involves.description: The predicate 'involves' indicates a relationship where the subject is engaged in or encompasses the processes, elements, or actions represented by the object. It suggests that the subject requires or utilizes the object as a component of its definition, function, or operation.

Predicate-is_maintained_even_with.label: is maintained even with
Predicate-is_maintained_even_with.description: The predicate 'is maintained even with' indicates that the subject retains its quality, effectiveness, or state despite the presence or influence of the object. It suggests resilience or robustness, implying that the subject can withstand challenges or limitations posed by the object without significant degradation.

Predicate-is_owing_to.label: is owing to
Predicate-is_owing_to.description: The predicate 'is owing to' establishes a causal or explanatory relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a result or consequence of the object. It suggests that the object provides the reason or basis for the existence, occurrence, or state of the subject.

Predicate-produces.label: produces
Predicate-produces.description: The predicate 'produces' indicates a causal or generative relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject is responsible for creating, generating, or resulting in the object. In this context, the subject actively contributes to the formation or emergence of the object, which can be a phenomenon, outcome, or set of characteristics.

Predicate-validated_with.label: validated with
Predicate-validated_with.description: The predicate 'validated with' indicates a relationship where the subject has undergone a process of verification or confirmation using the object as a basis or reference. This implies that the subject's effectiveness, accuracy, or reliability has been assessed through comparison or testing against the object, which serves as a standard or source of truth.

Predicate-from.label: from
Predicate-from.description: The predicate 'from' indicates a source or origin relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject is derived, obtained, or produced as a result of the object. It establishes a connection where the subject is linked to the object as the point of reference or the basis from which the subject emerges.

Predicate-in.label: in
Predicate-in.description: The predicate 'in' indicates a relationship of inclusion or containment, where the subject is situated within or is a part of the context or environment defined by the object. It suggests that the subject operates, exists, or is relevant within the parameters or characteristics specified by the object.

Predicate-utilizes.label: utilizes
Predicate-utilizes.description: The predicate 'utilizes' indicates that the subject employs or makes use of the object in order to achieve a specific function, purpose, or outcome. It signifies a relationship where the subject actively incorporates the object as a means to enhance its capabilities or effectiveness.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or type that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of concepts or entities, of which the subject is a part, thereby illustrating a classification or categorization structure.
